name: mutedly
content:
mutedly adverb
(QUIETLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not loud: The grand prix began mutedly because of dangerous surface water on the track. The machine whirred mutedly for a few moments and then stopped. Synonym
quietly
More examplesFewer examplesShe was just mutedly following orders.He was clearly upset, but mutedly.

mutedly adverb
(NOT ENTHUSIASTICALLY)
in a way that shows little enthusiasm: The players celebrated the result rather mutedly with their fans. There's been a strong international reaction from some countries, while others have reacted more mutedly. Synonyms
quietly
unenthusiastically
More examplesFewer examplesWe would like to propose a mutedly optimistic argument.

mutedly adverb
(NOT BRIGHTLY)
in a way that is not bright: She was wearing a mutedly floral summer dress. He has gained an international following with his beautiful, mutedly coloured prints.
More examplesFewer examplesThe top of the wall was painted a lighter shade than the mutedly toned panels below.
